chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy D. Hiler

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM cases 20CF1213, 20CF1215, 21CF225, 21CF611, 21CF619, 21CF1001, 22CF502 called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randy D. Hiler in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Randy D. Hiler. There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
As to Count 4 of the information in 21CF611: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 of the information in 21CF225: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 of the information in 20CF1215: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 of the information in 21CF1001: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
As to Count 1 of the information in 20CF1213: Defendant pleads Guilty. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Parties ask the court to follow the joint recommendation. 
As to Count 4 in 21CF611 and Count 6 in 21CF1001: Court orders court costs including a DNA sample. 
As to all other counts: Court withholds sentencing and places the defendant on Probation for 5 years with conditions: 
Defendant to pay restitution in the amounts of $2,540.03 (21CF1213) and $1,000.00 (dismissed and read in case 22CF502) plus applicable surcharges. 
No contact with: Any RCU location including RCU ATM's. No contact with J.F., E.S., J.H., K.K., S.T., I.L. or their residence. 
No contact with co defendant's: D.B., N.F., or B.W. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay court costs on all counts including two bench warrant fees in 20CF1213. 
As to Count 1 in 20CF1213: Court orders 180 days in Jail with Huber all except 60 days Stayed. Defendant must report to jail to complete the imposed 60 days on or by 6/20/2022. 
Defendant has 10 days credit in 20CF1213 and 20CF1215 and 8 days credit in 21CF225 if revoked from Probation.
Plea hearing on June 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Cases 22CF502, 21CF1001, 21CF619, 21CF611, 21CF225, 20CF1215, 20CF1213 are called at 1:43 PM) Defendant Randy D. Hiler in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Randy D. Hiler.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF502. 
Arraignment in 22CF502 & States Conference in 21CF1001, 21CF619, 21CF611, 21CF225, 20CF1215, 20CF1213 to be scheduled with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.

11:35am Cases called: 20CF1213, 20CF1215, 21CF225, 21CF611, 21CF619, 21CF1001 & 22CF502 Defendant Randy D. Hiler in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Randy D. Hiler. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

22CF502: Waives reading of the complaint. State requests a $5000 cash bond in this file. Defense argues for a signature bond. Court orders a $2,500 cash bond. Preliminary hearing set. Other cases will ride along. Defendant taken into custody.

Conditions:
No contact with S.T. or any Royal Credit Union locations.
No contact with any ATM's.

ADDRESS INFO for Randy D. Hiler
Current: 848 Kari Drive #4, Eau Claire, WI 54701 United States  (Effective: 05-03-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Eau Claire, WI 54703

(Case called at 11:57 AM) No appearance by Defendant Randy Hiler in person or by Zoom) ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
State indicates they were going to ask for cash but notes the Defendant does have other cases scheduled for 05/16/2022 at 11:30 AM. 
Initial Appearance: 05/16/2022 at 11:30 AM. (Branch 1)
